title: Entanglement Entropy as a Probe Beyond the Horizon
authors:
Konstantinos Boutivas, Dimitrios Katsinis, Georgios Pastras, Nikolaos
  Tetradis
abstract:
The entanglement entropy of a free field in de Sitter space is enhanced by
the squeezing of its modes. We show analytically that the expansion induces a
term in the entanglement entropy that depends logarithmically on the size of
the overall system, which may extend beyond the horizon. In cosmology the size
of the system can be identified with the size of a spatially finite universe,
or with the wavelength of the first mode that exited the horizon in the
beginning of inflation.
